resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

jorisvandenbossche commented on a change in pull request #12171:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12171#discussion_r786536217



##########
File path: .github/workflows/docs.yml
##########
@@ -32,6 +32,7 @@ on:
       - 'ci/scripts/js_build.sh'
       - 'ci/scripts/python_build.sh'
       - 'ci/scripts/r_build.sh'
+      - 'docs/**'

Review comment:
       This should only trigger the "light" job and not the "complete" job?




--

kszucs commented on a change in pull request #12171:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12171#discussion_r786583420



##########
File path: .github/workflows/docs.yml
##########
@@ -32,6 +32,7 @@ on:
       - 'ci/scripts/js_build.sh'
       - 'ci/scripts/python_build.sh'
       - 'ci/scripts/r_build.sh'
+      - 'docs/**'

jorisvandenbossche commented on a change in pull request #12171:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12171#discussion_r786591471



##########
File path: .github/workflows/docs.yml
##########
@@ -32,6 +32,7 @@ on:
       - 'ci/scripts/js_build.sh'
       - 'ci/scripts/python_build.sh'
       - 'ci/scripts/r_build.sh'
+      - 'docs/**'

Review comment:
       Hmm, that's a pity .. But what is otherwise the point of having the "light" job if the "complete" job will also always be triggered at the same time?




-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

kszucs commented on a change in pull request #12171:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12171#discussion_r786594998



##########
File path: .github/workflows/docs.yml
##########
@@ -32,6 +32,7 @@ on:
       - 'ci/scripts/js_build.sh'
       - 'ci/scripts/python_build.sh'
       - 'ci/scripts/r_build.sh'
+      - 'docs/**'

Review comment:
       Split into two workflows so we trigger the light build only on pull requests and the complete docs build only on pushes. 




--

ursabot commented on pull request #12171:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12171#issuecomment-1015292438


   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = 3e7a9f3e97f4cd847887703da039e88a608780c7 and contender = 0174d394a00e9985cd6fd238cf1a409792c583ea. 0174d394a00e9985cd6fd238cf1a409792c583ea is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.
   Conbench compare runs links:
   [Scheduled] [ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/340d2819300c46f888f726c669d33d0c...d14405544d4b4f509cb1dbff9a5eef41/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-i9-9960x](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/edbb9e1e9d504c5aad5078eb32efc275...1e56579a0e564e6fafd824d1a89200d3/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-thinkcentre-m75q](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/c944c0e2bbe24382a6442ae90764aad2...d06df1f0173c49839a6b5f4273147759/)
   Supported benchmarks:
   ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2: Supported benchmark langs: Python. Runs only benchmarks with cloud = True
   ursa-i9-9960x: Supported benchmark langs: Python, R, JavaScript
   ursa-thinkcentre-m75q: Supported benchmark langs: C++, Java
